summary: This document is a chain of emails from July 2020 between U.S. Attorney's Office personnel and defense attorney Glen McGorty regarding attempts to schedule a meeting and convey investigative questions to McGorty's client, referred to as 'Mr. [REDACTED]'. The prosecutors seek to determine if the client recognizes an individual named [REDACTED] who had connections to Jeffrey Epstein in the Virgin Islands.

persons.name: Glen McGorty
persons.role: Defense Attorney, Managing Partner at Crowell & Moring LLP
persons.context: Attorney representing a client ('Mr. [REDACTED]') who is being asked questions by the U.S. Attorney's Office regarding an individual connected to Jeffrey Epstein. He facilitates communication and scheduling.

persons.name: Danielle Giffuni
persons.context: CC'd on emails, assists with administrative tasks like confirming client contact information for Glen McGorty.

persons.name: Daniel Zelenko
persons.role: Assistant U.S. Attorney, Southern District of New York
persons.context: Prosecutor from the U.S. Attorney's Office leading the outreach to Glen McGorty to ask investigative questions about an Epstein associate. He references an 'ongoing investigation'.

persons.name: Donnie Murrell
persons.role: Criminal Defense Attorney (Board Certified Criminal Trial Lawyer)
persons.context: Previously involved in communications in 2019 regarding scheduling a meeting with the same client ('Mr. [REDACTED]') for the U.S. Attorney's Office.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned as the central figure whom an individual named [REDACTED] was potentially friends with and visited in the Virgin Islands.

connections.description: McGorty is the legal representative for the unnamed client, conveying questions from prosecutors and managing communication.
Prosecutor Zelenko is communicating with defense attorney McGorty as part of an ongoing investigation, seeking information from McGorty's client.
The individual [REDACTED] may have had a friendship with Epstein, visited his home in the Virgin Islands, and accompanied him on boat, helicopter, and/or plane trips.
Prosecutors are asking if McGorty's client recognizes [REDACTED], as [REDACTED] was listed as a contact in the client's phone and may have introduced individuals to him in the Virgin Islands.

events.title: Prosecutor Re-initiates Contact Regarding Investigation
events.description: Assistant U.S. Attorney Daniel Zelenko emails attorney Donnie Murrell to re-initiate contact after a long pause, stating 'our world changed substantially' after August 2019. He requests asking a client specific questions about recognizing an individual in a photo.

events.title: Attorney Acknowledges 'Crazy Times' at SDNY
events.description: Glen McGorty emails prosecutors, acknowledging 'crazy times in the Office these days' and referencing efforts by alumni to support the Office over 'recent developments'.

events.title: Prosecutors Provide Details on Epstein Associate
events.description: Prosecutors provide Glen McGorty with detailed information about an individual named [REDACTED] to convey to his client, including [REDACTED]'s connection to Epstein in the Virgin Islands.

events.title: Previous Scheduling Discussions for Meeting
events.description: Earlier email exchange shows prosecutors and attorney Donnie Murrell were tentatively scheduling a meeting with 'Mr. [REDACTED]' for the week of August 19, 2019.

keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office was actively investigating Jeffrey Epstein's network in July 2020, seeking information about an associate named [REDACTED] who worked in Saint Thomas and was connected to Epstein.

The investigation involved asking a third party ('Mr. [REDACTED]', represented by attorney Glen McGorty) if he recognized [REDACTED], as [REDACTED] was listed in the client's phone and may have introduced people to him in the Virgin Islands.
The email chain references a major disruption ('our world changed substantially') around August 2019, coinciding with Epstein's arrest and death, which paused earlier planned meetings.
Attorney Glen McGorty alludes to internal turmoil ('crazy times') and external support efforts for the SDNY in June 2020, likely referencing fallout from the Epstein case or other controversies.
The correspondence is explicitly marked as privileged attorney-client communication and attorney work product, indicating the sensitive nature of the discussions.
